Prime Motor Inns Inc. said it expects a substantial after-tax loss for the fiscal year that ended Saturday because it is establishing additional reserves and writing down assets. It said the amount of the reserves and adjustments would be $150 million, of which $80 million was related to its investment in certain securities of Servico Inc. and other transactions with Servico. Prime said proceeds from the sale of its Howard Johnson and Ramada franchises would result in a pretax gain of about $60 million in the quarter ending Sept. 30.
